body.name: The Vacation: An utterly gripping thriller packed with suspense

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love M M Chouinard books
reviews.reviewText: Once you start reading them, you can't stop. Love the characters and the endings are always a surprise. Please keep writing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Characters and Relationships
reviews.reviewText: The Vacation has enough essential characters that I initially felt I would become confused—I was wrong. The way Chouinard weaves their stories together removed all fear of confusion. She provided an easy-to-read and compelling saga of three families brought together with unintended consequences.Every scene brings a twist or reversal to the story. Turmoil abounds in the relationships of the six primary characters; there is no single protagonist. While six may seem unmanageable, Chouinard pulls it off in a manner I found successful and easy for a reader to comprehend. Slowly and almost unbeknownst to me, I developed a strong affection for three of the characters and disgust for the other three.Solving the mystery challenged me unsuccessfully until late in the story when Chouinard’s revelations took me by surprise.The Vacation was the first time I read her work—it won’t be the last.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I read this book while I was on a vacation, missed an entire day of lounging and swimming because it was SO good I had to stay in a quiet place to read. Truly an amazing book, the twist and turns the whole way, and you never see the end coming. It is a completely captivating and nail biting journey!! Must read!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It was ok
reviews.reviewText: The book held my interest enough that I finished it. I found the characters to be unbelievable. That being said, it's an easy read .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great compelling novel
reviews.reviewText: Discovered M.M. Chouinard during the pandemic and have become a huge fan of the Detective Jo Fournier series. Gripping characters and stellar writing. This stand alone is well worth the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just a book
reviews.reviewText: Not as interesting as I thought it would be

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full of twists and turns
reviews.reviewText: The Vacation is an exciting book. I did not see it ending the way it did. Rose seems timid and stressed out like a helicopter mom but proves in the end that she is a lot stronger than she thought she was. She has gumption!I could relate to this group of friends. Family dynamics always make for chaos. There were 3 couples and 4 kids. I didn't think I would remember who was who but as the story unfolded it was easier to keep up with everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars First time I read this author
reviews.reviewText: Never read anything by this author before but I really thought this was a good read. Not one of my favorite books but it kept me turning pages. I had a hard time remembering who was who because there were quite a few characters. Of course, that could just be my summer brain kicking in. My husband is a schoolteacher and home all summer. We lose track of what day it is in the summer.lol. I would recommend this this and read this author again.

I have enjoyed reading quite a few of the books from this author...and this one didn't disappoint!I like how she writes from 2 or 3 of the characters' points of view, but includes other possible 'suspects' in the storyline too. I often think I know for sure who is the guilty one, but nearer the end of the book, I start to question my choice. By the final page, the author has 'caught' me - or I have figured it out for sure beforehand.Always a good read...suspenseful and fun!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Good book based on what happened in Portugal no doubt. Ery different ending which made me wonder . Also shows how vindictive and thoughtless the media Are.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a really fascinating book
reviews.reviewText: I simply could not put it down. It was complicated, and I noticed how much I tried to decide who did what. Most of the time I had to keep changing my mind!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 27, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed this book and found it good read. I thought it was well.researched and the characters believable a typical family group holiday where there is always tensions between family members despite the friendships. A really good story with an unexpected ending I can recommend it to others.

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprised the reviews were so good.
reviews.reviewText: Took me until half way through the book to understand who all the characters were. But from then on I really enjoyed
